businessSummary.oneLiner: AI-powered data analytics platform for government and enterprise ‚Äî transforming from a core U.S. defense and intelligence software partner into a commercial AI powerhouse.
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since the launch of AIP (AI Platform), the commercial segment has been growing explosively. Q4 2025 revenue reached $1.407B (+70% YoY), with U.S. commercial revenue at $507M (+137% YoY). Recent developments include a DHS $1B 5-year BPA (Blanket Purchase Agreement), expanded AI infrastructure partnership with Rackspace, and a Mizuho upgrade to Buy. However, the stock is down 24% in 2026. The Percepta AI lawsuit saw a non-compete injunction denied, while DISA IL5/IL6 authorization was achieved ‚Äî a mixed picture overall.
howTheyMakeMoney: U.S. Government: Data analytics platforms for DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS, and others ‚Äî Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
U.S. Commercial: Enterprise AI/data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), the fastest-growing segment
International Government: Contracts with NATO allies and other foreign governments
International Commercial: Global enterprise clients (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription-based SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) ‚Äî Enterprise AI integration platform, the core growth engine
Gotham ‚Äî Data analysis and decision-making platform for government/defense
Foundry ‚Äî Enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo ‚Äî Software deployment automation and management infrastructure
TITAN ‚Äî U.S. Army next-generation intelligence system (large-scale contract)

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extremely elevated valuation. Even accounting for 70% growth, PEG of 2.3 places it in overvalued territory

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Even reflecting future earnings growth, this is more than 3x the software sector average

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: 10 consecutive quarters of acceleration. U.S. commercial +137% YoY. Among the highest in software industry history

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Rule of 40 = 127% (70% growth + 57% adjusted margin). Top tier in the software industry

keyMetrics.name: FCF (Annual)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Q4 adjusted FCF $791M (56% margin). Strong cash generation. +82% YoY

keyMetrics.name: Debt-to-Equity
keyMetrics.interpretation: Cash + short-term Treasuries $7.2B, zero debt. Current ratio 7.11. A net cash fortress

keyMetrics.name: 2026 Guidance
keyMetrics.interpretation: Adjusted FCF guidance $3.93‚Äì4.13B. Above-consensus guidance secures growth visibility

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-Year BPA ‚Äî Procurement Without Competitive Bidding
growthDrivers.description: Signed a 5-year, $1B Blanket Purchase Agreement with the Department of Homeland Security. CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA, and other DHS sub-agencies can procure Palantir software without competitive bidding. RPO surged from $2.6B to $4.2B (+$1.6B), reflecting the pipeline.

growthDrivers.title: Rackspace Partnership Expansion ‚Äî 250+ Dedicated Engineers
growthDrivers.description: Strategic partnership with Rackspace to accelerate AI deployment. Running Foundry and AIP on Rackspace Private Cloud and UK Sovereign data centers. Dedicated Palantir engineering team scaling from 30 to 250+ by early 2027.

growthDrivers.title: U.S. Commercial Revenue +137% ‚Äî Explosive Growth
growthDrivers.description: Q4 U.S. commercial revenue of $507M (+137% YoY). AIP-driven enterprise AI adoption is accelerating. Top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY).

growthDrivers.title: DISA IL5/IL6 Authorization + Airbus ~$1B + Navy $440M
growthDrivers.description: PFCS Forward IL5/IL6 authorization expands defense edge deployments. Large contracts secured consecutively. Pipeline is at an all-time high across both government and commercial segments.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Undisputed #1 in government/defense AI, with AIP rapidly establishing a strong commercial AI position. Irreplaceable in data security plus AI integration.

moats.description: Holds top-tier security authorizations from CIA, NSA, DHS, and others. DHS BPA enables procurement without competitive bidding. DISA IL5/IL6 authorized. It would take competitors years to achieve equivalent clearance levels.
More customers improve the AI models, and better models attract more customers ‚Äî creating a virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. The Airbus 10-year contract and DHS 5-year BPA demonstrate this.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.detail: Data cloud platform expanding AI capabilities, but weak in the government sector.

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.detail: Private company, data lakehouse. Competes in enterprise AI.

competitors.name: C3.ai
competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly lags in growth rate and scale.

competitors.name: Percepta AI
competitors.detail: Founded by former Palantir employees. Non-compete injunction denied, free to compete.

recentNews.headline: Mizuho Upgrades PLTR from Neutral to Outperform ($195) ‚Äî 'Growth + Margin Profile Is One of a Kind'
recentNews.significance: Mizuho analyst states 'the recent selloff is unjustifiable; AIP is a category of one,' upgrading to Buy. Stock fell -1.5% on the day, reflecting persistent selling pressure.

recentNews.headline: Percepta AI Lawsuit ‚Äî Non-Compete Injunction Denied, Only Employee Solicitation Ban Granted
recentNews.significance: Federal judge denied the request to bar three former key employees from working at Percepta AI. Only a ban on soliciting Palantir employees was granted. The competitor is now free to operate, materializing talent poaching risk.

recentNews.headline: DHS Awards $1B 5-Year BPA ‚Äî AI Platform Procurement Without Competitive Bidding
recentNews.significance: CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA, and other DHS sub-agencies can directly procure Palantir software. A single government contract adds $1B+ to backlog.

recentNews.headline: Rackspace Strategic Partnership ‚Äî Accelerating Foundry and AIP Enterprise Deployment
recentNews.significance: Deploying Foundry and AIP on Rackspace infrastructure, scaling dedicated engineers to 250+. A key partnership for expanding commercial AI distribution channels.

recentNews.headline: Down 24% in 2026 ‚Äî SaaS-pocalypse Selloff Persists Despite Three Bullish Catalysts
recentNews.significance: Stock declines despite DHS, Rackspace, and Mizuho catalysts. Caught up in the broader SaaS selloff driven by fears that AI could replace traditional SaaS.

analystOpinions.notableComment: 9 out of 20 analysts rate Buy, 10 Hold. Average target $188 (+41%). Mizuho upgraded to Outperform $195 on 2/21, HSBC Buy $205, Citi $260 (street high), BofA Buy $255. Burry warns of a drop to $50‚Äì60. The 36% correction from ATH has reduced entry pressure.

risks.title: Extreme Valuation ‚Äî P/E 215x, Down 24% in 2026
risks.description: P/E of 215x, PEG of 2.3 signals overvaluation. Amid the SaaS-pocalypse, further downside is possible. Burry has identified a head-and-shoulders pattern suggesting a decline to $50‚Äì60.

risks.title: Percepta AI Talent Drain + Non-Compete Injunction Denied
risks.description: Three former key employees founded Percepta AI. Federal judge denied the non-compete injunction, allowing the competitor to operate freely. Only an employee solicitation ban was granted.

risks.title: Burry's 'Wicked Accounting' Criticism ‚Äî AR Surge, CEO Compensation Controversy
risks.description: Accounts receivable grew faster than revenue in 9 of 12 quarters. CEO Karp's $17M jet costs (+123% YoY). Share count diluting +4.67% YoY.

risks.title: SaaS-pocalypse ‚Äî Fears That AI Could Replace Traditional SaaS
risks.description: Market fears that AI will render traditional SaaS obsolete are driving broad SaaS selloffs. Stock declining despite DHS, Rackspace, and Mizuho catalysts proves deteriorating sentiment.

risks.title: Government Budget Dependency and DOGE Spending Cut Risk
risks.description: While the DHS $1B BPA is positive, government spending cut initiatives could have a direct impact.

buyReasons.title: DHS $1B BPA + Airbus $1B + Navy $440M ‚Äî Pipeline at All-Time High
buyReasons.rationale: Major contracts secured consecutively. The DHS BPA creates a procurement channel without competitive bidding, locking in long-term revenue. 2026 guidance of $7.18‚Äì7.20B (+60% YoY) secures growth visibility.

buyReasons.title: 36% Correction from ATH + Debt-Free Cash Fortress of $7.2B
buyReasons.rationale: Cash + short-term Treasuries of $7.2B, zero debt, current ratio of 7.11. Mizuho Buy $195, HSBC Buy $205, Citi $260. Consensus $188 implies +41% upside.

buyReasons.title: Rule of 40 = 127% ‚Äî Unprecedented Growth + Margin in Software History
buyReasons.rationale: 70% growth + 57% adjusted margin. U.S. commercial +137% YoY explosive growth. AIP enterprise adoption is accelerating, and the Rackspace partnership expands deployment channels.

overallOpinion: DHS $1B BPA, Rackspace partnership, and U.S. commercial +137% growth demonstrate real traction
P/E of 215x is overvalued territory, but the SaaS-pocalypse and Burry attacks have driven a 24% decline in 2026, now 36% off ATH
Mizuho Buy upgrade to $195, HSBC $205, plus a debt-free $7.2B cash position strengthen the downside floor
Percepta AI non-compete injunction denial materializes talent drain risk ‚Äî watch whether the structural moat holds
Q1 earnings will determine whether this is 'unfairly caught in the SaaS-pocalypse' or 'valuation normalization'

sources.name: Motley Fool ‚Äî Palantir $1B Deal
sources.description: DHS contract analysis, evidence of AI adoption acceleration

sources.name: Benzinga ‚Äî PLTR Friday
sources.description: 2/21 price action, Percepta non-compete injunction denied

sources.name: Benzinga ‚Äî Burry Moat Criticism
sources.description: Burry: 'Moat is just obstruction of data transfer,' AR surge criticism

sources.description: P/E 215, Forward P/E 103, FCF $2.27B financial metrics

sources.name: MarketBeat ‚Äî PLTR Forecast
sources.description: HSBC Buy $205, BofA Buy $255, latest analyst distribution
